trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_00<tab>Sphene is in higher spirits.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_01<tab>Your meeting with Milos seems to have lifted Sphene's spirits, and she proposes buying a gift for your friends in the Backroom. However, your shopping is interrupted when an unfamiliar voice uses Alexandria's loudspeakers to inform one and all that neo regulators will no longer be distributed to the populace. The news sparks unease among those nearby, and you decide to make haste and return to the Backroom immediately. Shale greets you with a mixture of concern and relief, but shortly thereafter you are informed by Nostalgia that one of Alexandria's citizens was killed by a rogue mechanical soldier. Before your comrades can process this news, Erenville contacts you via linkpearl, reporting a similar incident in the outskirts. He then breaks contact after saying he will try to lead a group of soldiers away from a nearby settlement. Shale entreats you to go to his aid, and you quickly assemble a group to investigate Erenville's last known location.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_02<tab>When you arrive at the settlement in the outskirts, Erenville is nowhere in sight. Wuk Lamat instructs Sphene and Gulool Ja to search the settlement while you, she, and Alisaie search further outside for your missing ally.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_03<tab>You scour East Yyasulani until you finally catch sight of a group of mechanical soldiers assaulting a pair of Shetona. The faulty sentries fall quickly before your wrath, and luckily the two frightened men appear to be unharmed.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_04<tab>Not soon after you help Erenville and the other Shetona to their feet, Alisaie and Wuk Lamat join you. As you share your experiences and observations, it becomes clear that there is no rhyme or reason to which soldiers are hostile, and which are friendly. Erenville wishes to check on the other civilians, and together you return to the settlement.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_05<tab>Your allies are gathered near the aetheryte along with a familiar face: Malachite. He tells you he came to the settlement to retrieve the slain citizen, but when he arrived, the body was nowhere to be found. The usher returns to Solution Nine, and not soon after, you and others present are contacted by others via linkpearl. From G'raha Tia in the city, you learn of an incident caused by malfunctioning machinery─one of many similar instances of Alexandrians being hurt by machines and soldiers, it would seem. Upon hearing of the developing situation, Sphene rushes towards Solution Nine, and Wuk Lamat follows close on her heels. Leaving Erenville in the care of the other Oblivion members, you and your companions head toward the city, uncertain what awaits.
The familiar sounds of combat fill the air as you enter Solution Nine and spy scattered fires in the distance. You come upon Wuk Lamat caring for a wounded citizen, and she bids you go ahead and catch up with Sphene. Fighting your way through rogue soldiers and malfunctioning machines, you find the former queen kneeling before the lifeless body of an Alexandrian. While Sphene is overcome with emotion by this senseless slaughter, she is determined to fight on, and together you go to reunite with your allies in the government sector. There you learn that the machines seem to have ceased their rampage, and none of your companions were injured in the chaos. Alas, the same cannot be said for Alexandria's people, and Sphene asks that you help render aid. You and your allies pledge to do so, and all present make ready to commence rescue and relief efforts, while G'raha Tia bids you return to the Backroom and inform Shale of all that has transpired.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SEQ_06<tab>While the tidings you bring Shale are far from good, she is quick to form a plan to have Oblivion's people keep watch over Alexandria's machines. Amidst this uneasy peace, you and your allies must hone your skills and search for Calyx, whose whereabouts and future schemes remain a mystery.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat in the outskirts.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_TODO_01<tab>Search for Erenville and defeat any enemies that appear.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_TODO_02<tab>Aid Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Shale in the Backroom.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_000<tab>I wish the Endless Sphene could have been here to see Milos...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_000_001<tab>As I treated Milos with Angelo, I couldn't help but think of Ga Bu and Halric. I wonder how they've been.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_004<tab>Lamaty'i told me all about Milos. She said he was around my age, but couldn't leave his bed.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_005<tab>I'd like to go meet him next time. Maybe we can be friends.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_010<tab>Milos is a kind and brave boy. It did me well to see him.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_011<tab>One day, I hope that I can speak with him about my other self.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_012<tab>Come, let us return to the Backroom. And on the way, let us pick up treats for our friends─a little gift to show our appreciation for their hard work.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHALE_000_013<tab>Geode, can you hear me? Something's happened in the outskirts...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_014<tab>The people here took care of me, giving me food and making sure I was alright. I can't bear to imagine the soldiers hurting them...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_015<tab>So this is how it is outside... These clouds... Ah, never mind─ Finding Erenville is what matters right now.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_000_017<tab>I don't see Erenville. I pray he hasn't come to harm...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>Things have settled down here, but I still see no sign of Erenville. Let's split up and look for him.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_021<tab>Gulool Ja, Sphene─please search in the settlement area.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_022<tab>Meanwhile, the rest of us who can defend ourselves will head further out.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHETONA05306_000_030<tab>Thank you, oh, thank you!
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>That was a close call... My thanks.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ERENVILLE_000_041<tab>As I was leading the soldiers away, I caught sight of this poor fellow being pursued.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ERENVILLE_000_042<tab>I went to help, but was rather out of my depth. We're lucky you found us when you did.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_043<tab>Erenville! I'm so glad you're safe!
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_000_044<tab>We were quite worried when we couldn't find you.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_045<tab>We encountered soldiers on the way here. Most paid us no mind, but some turned out to be hostile. There's no way to tell until they set on you.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ERENVILLE_000_046<tab>The ones here also attacked without any warning. If I hadn't been paying attention, it could've ended badly...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ERENVILLE_000_047<tab>Hopefully the others were able to escape. We should return to the outskirts and take stock.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHALE_000_048<tab>Erenville is safe? What a relief...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_049<tab>I didn't expect to see Malachite out here. Given his own trauma, I wonder if he'll be alright...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_050<tab>Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. For protecting everyone.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_051<tab>But...you shouldn't have had to. None of this would've happened if I could control the soldiers...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_052<tab>No one thought that Gulool Ja might have been behind the attacks. They know that he would never make the soldiers do them harm.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_053<tab>Even so, he feels responsible for the machines' actions. 'Tis a misplaced burden, and I pray it drives him not to despair.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_000_054<tab>The situation here appears to have been resolved, but I doubt we've seen the last of such incidents...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GEODE_000_055<tab>We responded to Shale's call as quickly as we could. Others are out keeping an eye on soldiers nearby.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_MALACHITE_000_056<tab>I did not expect to see you again so soon. Allow me to thank you again for your earlier help.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALPHINAUD_200_100<tab>Thank the Twelve you are all unharmed.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALPHINAUD_200_101<tab>'Tis small solace amidst this tragedy, however...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_YSHTOLA_200_102<tab>The machine rampage seems to have been only temporary. Soldiers and vehicles alike ceased to operate all at once, as if they had fulfilled their purpose.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_200_103<tab>It's the same outside Everkeep, though members of Oblivion are keeping watch for good measure.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ALISAIE_210_103<tab>...The first attacks came shortly after the announcement that neo regulators had run out. It can't have been a coincidence.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_KRILE_210_104<tab>I struggle to imagine that anyone but Calyx could gain control of the soldiers. This must have served his ends in some way...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_KRILE_200_104<tab>Gulool Ja, are you still without your authority?
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_200_105<tab>It's fine now. I'm in control again.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_YSHTOLA_200_106<tab>We might take the opportunity to shut down the machines. There's no guarantee this won't happen again.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_200_107<tab>Lamaty'i just talked with Everkeep's administrators about that. They said it wasn't so simple...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_200_108<tab>The mechanical soldiers don't only serve as guards. They also perform various vital tasks, like providing medical treatment and managing food production.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_200_109<tab>If we shut them down, we'd struggle to render aid to the citizens, let alone restore their lives to normal.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_200_110<tab>I made it so they can't use weapons anymore, though. Hopefully that makes it a little safer...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_YSHTOLA_200_111<tab>That seems the best approach for now. Thank you for your swift action, Gulool Ja.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_112<tab>This powerlessness... I can abide it no longer...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_113<tab>No matter how much hardship and loss, we could endure if there was but happiness at the end...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_114<tab>Yet all I see now is suffering and misery...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_115<tab>And I cannot bear it.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_116<tab>I want to protect the people. For their happiness, I would do anything and everything.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_200_117<tab>So please... Please lend me your aid!
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_200_118<tab>Oh Sphene...you've found the words I wished you'd said back then...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_200_120<tab>Our strength is yours, Sphene! Together, we'll get through this!
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GRAHATIA_200_121<tab>Let us split up and get to work. Might I trouble you to report to Shale, my friend?
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_200_121<tab>Let us split up and get to work. Might I trouble you to report to Shale, my friend?
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_WUKLAMAT_000_060<tab>Malachite and his fellows are tending to the deceased. His trauma must make the work difficult, but he's determined to do what he can.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_GULOOLJA_000_061<tab>Couriers and cleaners are clearing away the wrecks of vehicles and soldiers. It's the first step to getting things back to normal.

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_070<tab>It pains me that the people were made to suffer even more after so much hardship and tragedy...but you and yours saved many lives. I cannot thank you enough.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHALE_000_078<tab>It's been a trying day, but it seems the worst is behind us. What's the situation out there now?

TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHALE_000_079<tab>You've moved quickly to restore things to normal. Thank you. Yet while disarming the soldiers is indeed prudent, it is a far from comprehensive measure when vehicles can be commandeered to inflict damage and sow chaos...
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_SHALE_000_080<tab>For the time being, I'll set our people to keeping a close watch on machines. I also have a mind to consult the authorities about enlisting hunters to our aid.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_082<tab>I must regain my proficiency in magic. To that end, I shall seek advice from Y'shtola and Alisaie.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_083<tab>Among the books we recovered from the castle was a grimoire I once used. I hope to learn to wield it again, at everyone's side.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_084<tab>As for the key, I think it best that it remains in your care, though it means you will bear the greatest risk.
TEXT_KINGMH108_05306_ORIGINALSPHENE_000_085<tab>In order to ease your burden, I shall endeavor to become a capable warrior and make Otis and Zelenia proud!
